programme.title: A Day That Changed the Game
programme.desc: How the standard hockey stick added a curve to it, and how it changed the way the game is played forever.

programme.title: NHL Hockey Montreal Canadiens at Washington Capitals
programme.desc: The Eastern Conference-best Capitals host the Canadiens for Game 1 of a first-round set. Montreal was the final team to punch its ticket to the postseason. Washington has lost its last five playoff series since winning the 2018 Stanley Cup Final.

programme.title: NHL Hockey Montreal Canadiens at Washington Capitals
programme.desc: Alex Ovechkin and the Capitals collide with the Canadiens in Game 2 of their Eastern Conference first-round series. Ovechkin scored twice, including his first career playoff overtime goal, to give Washington a 3-2 victory over Montreal in Game 1.

programme.title: NHL Hockey Washington Capitals at Montreal Canadiens
programme.desc: Game 3 of this Stanley Cup Playoffs first-round series sees the Canadiens, down 2-0, hosting the Capitals. Washington defended home ice with a 3-1 victory in Game 2. Connor McMichael scored twice for the Caps, while Dylan Strome netted the winner.

programme.title: NHL Hockey Washington Capitals at Montreal Canadiens
programme.desc: The Canadiens and Capitals play Game 4 of their first-round series. Montreal cut Washington's series lead in half with a 6-3 decision Game 3. Both starting goaltenders, Logan Thompson (WSH) and Sam Montembeault (MTL), left the contest with injury.

programme.title: NHL Hockey Montreal Canadiens at Washington Capitals
programme.desc: The Capitals try to advance to the second round in Game 5 of their East quarterfinal with the Canadiens. Washington pushed Montreal to the brink by pulling away for a 5-2 Game 4 triumph. Dylan Strome leads the Caps with seven points this postseason.
